question_text: Using a calendar year as an analogy to the geologic time scale, when do the oldest anatomically modern humans appear on Earth?

question_text: Since temperatures in Earth increase with depth, why is the inner core solid?

answers.text: Earth's interior does not reach temperatures high enough to melt the material of the inner core. ->
answers.match_pair: Earth's interior does not reach temperatures high enough to melt the material of the inner core. ->

answers.text: The inner core is shedding the heat so quickly that melting does not have time to occur. ->
answers.match_pair: The inner core is shedding the heat so quickly that melting does not have time to occur. ->

answers.text: Temperatures increase to a certain point before leveling off below the melting point of the core. ->
answers.match_pair: Temperatures increase to a certain point before leveling off below the melting point of the core. ->

answers.text: The pressures in the core are immense and keep it in a solid state despite the temperature. ->
answers.match_pair: The pressures in the core are immense and keep it in a solid state despite the temperature. ->
